original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 293.25/294.00 to dollar, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 293.25 /294.00 against the US dollar in the spot market on Wednesday, while bond yields were steady, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 293.50/294.50 to the US dollar on Monday after opening around 296.75 /297.25 rupees.
A bond maturing on 01.09.2027 was quoted at 26.50/80, following a steady from the previous close at 26.50/65 on Tuesday.
Sri Lanka’s rupee is appreciating amid negative private credit which has reduced outflows after the central bank hiked rates and stopped printing money. (Colombo/ May 30/2023)
